dialogue.text: Oh. Well, hello there.
To what do I owe the pleasure, Sensei?
No pleasure involved, just here to kill some time.
No pleasure involved? Not even a little bit?
I mean...if you want there to be pleasure...
Of course I want there to be pleasure.
Why else would I have this word-coated rectangular object in my hands?
Weird way to say “book” but okay.
What I mean to ask is why bother indulging yourself in anything if there is nothing to leech from it?
We are all but leeches, Sensei. Digging our tiny, jagged teeth into anything they’ll latch onto in search of the essence of life.
Weird way to say “blood” but okay again.
Would you at least agree that words without experience are meaningless?
It’s something that appeared inside of this very rectangle and I’d be a liar if I were to say it didn’t provoke some impure thoughts in this old noggin of mine.
You’re still in [high_school]. Your noggin is absolutely not “old.”
No, it is not.
But that calls into question exactly why I am reading {i}this{/i} specific piece of literature despite having no experience in its subject matter.
If words without experience are meaningless, shouldn’t {i}these{/i} words, which I have no experience {i}with{/i}, simply bounce off the walls of my brain without so much as leaving a minor bruise?
Can brains even bruise?
Probably? I can’t imagine it would feel very nice, though.
What are you reading anyway?
“Clifford the Big Red Dog.” Are you familiar with it?
Vaguely. I feel like I read that a long time ago but I’m kind of hazy on the details.
I’m not surprised you’ve read it given your...demeanor so far.
Yeah. I really do present myself as a Clifford lover, don't I?
There's so much about you I can deduce just from that little factoid alone.
Are you suggesting something about me, Nodoka?
I'm not {i}not{/i} suggesting something about you, dog lover.
Is this a manipulation tactic?
What would I possibly manipulate you into doing that you wouldn’t already do on your own?
Reading more books.
Ahh, yes. The consumption of knowledge has become more taboo than any illicit relationship out there.
It’s certainly starting to feel like that, at least.
I’m surprised you’ve managed to go so long without diving into a word-maze, though.
Jesus, Nodoka. Just use the word “book.”
Well now I’m just going to continue abstaining out of sheer spite.
Of course you are...
Futaba tells me you used to be a writer, Sensei.
Why is it that you’ve given up on that?
At this point, my brain is so all over the place that I feel like anything I write would come out twisted and indiscernible.
Clifford's really gotten to you, huh?
Why is he so big? They never explain it.
Sensei...you’re {i}really{/i} trying to excite me now, aren’t you?
What? No. I'm trying to open up to you about what the book series has done to me.
What the fuck. Don't just leave.
{i}Can't hear you!{/i}
I feel so alone all of a sudden.
Either way, I decide to simply go home and rest.
{i}Nodoka's affection has increased to [nodoka_love]!{/i}
